bug.short_desc: Parsing date by format should ignore invalid/missing whitespace

long_desc.thetext:
Following code does not work
new qx.util.format.DateFormat("MM/dd/yyyy").parse("10/10/2012 ")
This is typical czech format new qx.util.format.DateFormat("d. M. yyyy").parse("10.10.2012")
Problem is, that if you either omit a space a include extra one, parser fails. The real problem then happens with qx.ui.form.DateField, where using czech locale it uses above format as default. Which means that user, when writing date by hand, must use spaces EXACLTY as in format, which is very user-unfriendly.
Reason i'm reporting it on DateFormat itself is that I don't see any point in being so strict. If you will disagree, I'll open another issue on DateField itself, where this is big problem.
